question.text: The consumption of fast food has increased dramatically in recent years. What are the advantages and disadvantages of this trend?

questionType.explanation: You must discuss BOTH advantages and disadvantages of increased fast food consumption, then give your clear opinion about whether the advantages outweigh the disadvantages or vice versa.
requirements: Discuss advantages of fast food consumption
Discuss disadvantages of fast food consumption
Give your clear personal opinion on which side is stronger
Provide specific examples for both advantages and disadvantages

keyWords.importance: This is about how much fast food people eat, not just availability

keyWords.definition: Ready-made meals prepared quickly in restaurants like McDonald's
keyWords.importance: This is the main topic - be specific about what fast food means
Shows this is a recent and significant trend
You MUST discuss the good sides of fast food consumption
You MUST discuss the bad sides of fast food consumption

essayStructure.introduction: 2-3 sentences: Paraphrase question + state your opinion on whether advantages outweigh disadvantages
essayStructure.body2: 4-5 sentences: Discuss disadvantages (health problems, nutrition issues)
essayStructure.conclusion: 2 sentences: Summarize both sides + restate opinion clearly

commonMistakes: Only discussing disadvantages (health) and ignoring advantages
Being too neutral - you must take a clear position
Forgetting to give concrete examples and statistics
Copying words directly from the question
Writing only about fast food restaurants instead of consumption patterns

structure.introduction: The consumption of [Topic] has increased dramatically. While this trend offers [advantages], I believe the [disadvantages] are more significant.
structure.body1: On the one hand, [Topic] provides [Main advantage]. This is because [Reason/explanation]. For instance, [Specific example]. As a result, [Consequence or benefit].
structure.body2: On the other hand, [Topic] presents [Main disadvantage]. The main reason is [Reason/explanation]. For example, [Specific example]. Therefore, [Conclusion about this concern].
structure.conclusion: In conclusion, while [Brief summary of advantages], I believe [Restate that disadvantages outweigh advantages].

example.introduction: The consumption of fast food has increased dramatically. While this trend offers convenience and affordability, I believe the health disadvantages are more significant.
example.body1: On the one hand, fast food provides practical benefits for modern consumers. This is because it saves significant time for busy professionals and families. For instance, working parents can obtain meals within minutes rather than spending hours cooking. As a result, people can better manage their work and personal commitments.
example.body2: On the other hand, fast food presents substantial health risks. The main reason is that these meals contain excessive calories, sodium, and unhealthy fats. For example, studies show regular consumption increases diabetes risk by 50%. Therefore, the long-term health consequences are deeply concerning.
example.conclusion: In conclusion, while fast food offers convenience and cost savings, I believe the serious health disadvantages significantly outweigh these benefits.

structure.introduction: Although [acknowledge advantages briefly], I firmly believe the disadvantages of [Topic] far outweigh any benefits because [main reason].
structure.body1: Admittedly, [Topic] does provide [Main advantage + brief explanation with example]. However, [transition to acknowledge limitation].
structure.body2: The primary concern with [Topic] is [Main disadvantage]. [Detailed explanation]. [Specific example/statistic]. [Consequence]. This makes [Topic] particularly problematic for [affected group].
structure.conclusion: To summarize, despite [brief mention of advantages], the [disadvantages], particularly [most important concern], make this trend deeply concerning.

structure.introduction: [Restate trend]. This essay will examine both the benefits and drawbacks before concluding that [your position].
structure.body1: The advantages of [Topic] are primarily [Category 1: convenience/economy]. Firstly, [Point 1]. Secondly, [Point 2]. For example, [Supporting example showing both points].
structure.body2: However, the disadvantages relate to [Category 2: health/society]. Chief among these is [Main concern]. This results in [Effect/consequence]. Furthermore, [Secondary concern with example]. These issues are particularly evident in [specific context/location].
structure.conclusion: In conclusion, although [advantages], the [disadvantages] are more concerning because [final reason prioritizing long-term over short-term].

steps.title: Build Paragraphs
steps.completionCriteria: Complete all 4 paragraphs (10+ words per blank)

content.instructions: Fill in each blank to build your essay paragraph by paragraph. Aim for 10-15 words per blank. Click 'Show Hint' if you need help.

paragraphs.name: Introduction
paragraphs.template: The consumption of fast food has increased dramatically in recent years. While this trend _____ [state the advantages briefly], I believe _____ [clearly state YOUR position that disadvantages outweigh advantages].

blanks.label: State advantages briefly
blanks.placeholder: e.g., offers convenience and affordability for time-constrained consumers and budget-conscious families

blanks.label: Your position (disadvantages outweigh)
blanks.hint: Be clear! Say the disadvantages/health problems are more significant
blanks.placeholder: e.g., the serious health disadvantages, particularly obesity and chronic diseases, far outweigh these practical benefits

paragraphs.name: Body Paragraph 1
paragraphs.template: On the one hand, _____ [topic sentence about advantages]. This is because _____ [explain the reason]. For instance, _____ [give a specific example]. As a result, _____ [state the consequence or benefit].

blanks.label: Topic sentence - fast food advantages
blanks.hint: Main benefit: convenience, affordability, or time-saving
blanks.placeholder: e.g., increased fast food consumption provides significant practical advantages for modern consumers in terms of convenience and cost

blanks.label: Explain the reason
blanks.hint: WHY does fast food provide this benefit? Explain how it works.
blanks.placeholder: e.g., busy professionals and families can obtain ready-to-eat meals within minutes without spending time on meal preparation or cooking

blanks.label: Specific example
blanks.hint: Give concrete example - price, time saved, specific situation
blanks.placeholder: e.g., working parents can purchase a complete family meal for under $20 and have it ready in less than 10 minutes

blanks.label: Consequence/benefit
blanks.hint: What is the final outcome or impact of this advantage?
blanks.placeholder: e.g., this allows people to better manage their work schedules and family commitments without sacrificing mealtime convenience

paragraphs.name: Body Paragraph 2
paragraphs.template: On the other hand, _____ [topic sentence about disadvantages]. The main reason is _____ [explain why this is problematic]. For example, _____ [specific example or statistic]. Therefore, _____ [conclusion about why this is concerning].

blanks.label: Topic sentence - health disadvantages
blanks.hint: Main health problem: obesity, diseases, poor nutrition
blanks.placeholder: e.g., increased fast food consumption presents substantial health risks that have serious long-term consequences for individuals and society

blanks.label: Explain why problematic
blanks.hint: Explain the mechanism - what's in fast food that causes harm
blanks.placeholder: e.g., fast food meals typically contain excessive calories, saturated fats, and sodium while lacking essential nutrients and fiber

blanks.label: Specific example or statistic
blanks.hint: Use statistics, studies, or specific health conditions
blanks.placeholder: e.g., research shows that consuming fast food more than twice weekly increases the risk of developing type 2 diabetes by nearly 50 percent

blanks.label: Conclusion about why concerning
blanks.placeholder: e.g., these health consequences create enormous healthcare costs and significantly reduce quality of life for millions of people worldwide

paragraphs.name: Conclusion
paragraphs.template: In conclusion, while _____ [briefly acknowledge advantages], I believe _____ [strongly restate that disadvantages outweigh advantages and why].

blanks.label: Acknowledge advantages briefly
blanks.hint: One sentence mentioning the practical benefits
blanks.placeholder: e.g., fast food offers undeniable convenience and affordability for busy modern consumers

blanks.label: Restate disadvantages outweigh
blanks.hint: Be emphatic! Health problems are more important than convenience
blanks.placeholder: e.g., the serious and long-lasting health consequences, including obesity, diabetes, and cardiovascular disease, make this trend deeply problematic and far outweigh any short-term practical benefits

content.instructions: Now combine your paragraphs into a complete essay. You can copy from Step 5 and edit, or write fresh. Aim for 250-280 words total.

introduction.purpose: Paraphrase question + state your opinion (disadvantages outweigh)

body1.purpose: Discuss advantages with reasons and examples

body2.purpose: Discuss disadvantages with reasons and examples (make this stronger)

checklist: Introduction clearly states your opinion that disadvantages outweigh advantages
Body paragraph 1 discusses practical advantages with example
Body paragraph 2 discusses health disadvantages with statistics/evidence
Body paragraph 2 is stronger and more detailed than body paragraph 1
Conclusion emphasizes that disadvantages are more significant
Variety of sentence structures (simple, compound, complex)

modelEssay.text:
The prevalence of fast food consumption has risen dramatically in recent decades. While this trend offers certain practical advantages, I believe the detrimental health consequences significantly outweigh these benefits.

On the one hand, increased fast food consumption provides notable convenience and affordability for modern consumers. Busy professionals and families can obtain ready-to-eat meals within minutes, eliminating the time required for shopping, cooking, and cleaning. Furthermore, fast food is considerably more affordable than dining at traditional restaurants, with complete meals available for under $10 at most chains. This accessibility proves particularly beneficial for low-income families and time-constrained individuals who struggle to balance work and personal commitments.

On the other hand, the health disadvantages of regular fast food consumption are substantial and concerning. These meals typically contain excessive calories, saturated fats, and sodium while lacking essential nutrients and dietary fiber. Research indicates that individuals who consume fast food more than twice weekly face a 50% increased risk of developing type 2 diabetes compared to those who rarely eat it. Moreover, the strong correlation between fast food prevalence and rising obesity rates cannot be ignored. In countries like the United States and United Kingdom, obesity rates have tripled over the past 30 years, coinciding directly with the expansion of fast food chains. These chronic health conditions not only diminish quality of life but also create enormous healthcare costs for individuals and society.

In conclusion, while fast food undeniably offers convenience and affordability, the severe long-term health consequences, including obesity, diabetes, and cardiovascular disease, make this dietary trend deeply problematic and far more significant than any short-term practical benefits.
